channel.title: CVE Feed for AMD -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AMD -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-26353|2024-08-03T20:26:24.535Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Failure to validate inputs in SMM may allow an attacker to create a mishandled error leaving the DRTM UApp in a partially initialized state potentially resulting in loss of memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26398|2024-08-03T20:26:24.878Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation in SYS_KEY_DERIVE system call in a compromised user application or ABL may allow an attacker to corrupt ASP (AMD Secure Processor) OS memory which may lead to potential arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26364|2024-08-03T20:26:25.041Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in an SMU mailbox register could allow an attacker to potentially read outside of the SRAM address range which could result in an exception handling leading to a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26338|2024-08-03T20:26:23.933Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Improper access controls in System Management Unit (SMU) may allow for an attacker to override performance control tables located in DRAM resulting in a potential lack of system resources.

item.title: CVE-2021-26363|2024-08-03T20:26:24.452Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL could potentially change the value that the ASP uses for its reserved DRAM, to one outside of the fenced area, potentially leading to data exposure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26323|2024-08-03T20:19:20.475Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Failure to validate SEV Commands while SNP is active may result in a potential impact to memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26360|2024-08-03T20:26:25.015Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%206000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w6000%20series
item.description: An attacker with local access to the system can make unauthorized modifications of the security configuration of the SOC registers. This could allow potential corruption of AMD secure processor’s encrypted memory contents which may lead to arbitrary code execution in ASP.

item.title: CVE-2021-26365|2024-08-03T20:26:25.153Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Certain size values in firmware binary headers could trigger out of bounds reads during signature validation, leading to denial of service or potentially limited leakage of information about out-of-bounds memory contents.

item.title: CVE-2021-26409|2024-08-03T20:26:25.399Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in SEV-ES may allow an attacker to corrupt Reverse Map table (RMP) memory, potentially resulting in a loss of SNP (Secure Nested Paging) memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26354|2024-08-03T20:26:25.140Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in ASP may allow an attacker to issue a system call from a compromised ABL which may cause arbitrary memory values to be initialized to zero, potentially leading to a loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26379|2024-08-03T20:26:25.077Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation of mailbox data in the SMU may allow an attacker to coerce the SMU to corrupt SMRAM, potentially leading to a loss of integrity and privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2022-29900|2024-08-03T06:33:43.145Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Mis-trained branch predictions for return instructions may allow arbitrary speculative code execution under certain microarchitecture-dependent conditions.

item.title: CVE-2021-26355|2024-08-03T20:26:25.057Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient fencing and checks in System Management Unit (SMU) may result in access to invalid message port registers that could result in a potential denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26356|2024-08-03T20:26:24.804Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: A TOCTOU in ASP bootloader may allow an attacker to tamper with the SPI ROM following data read to memory potentially resulting in S3 data corruption and information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26327|2024-08-03T20:19:20.137Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient validation of guest context in the SNP Firmware could lead to a potential loss of guest confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2021-26373|2024-08-03T20:26:24.768Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in the System Management Unit (SMU) may result in a system voltage malfunction that could result in denial of resources and/or possibly denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26331|2024-08-03T20:26:23.953Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: AMD System Management Unit (SMU) contains a potential issue where a malicious user may be able to manipulate mailbox entries leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26407|2024-08-03T20:26:25.463Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: A randomly generated Initialization Vector (IV) may lead to a collision of IVs with the same key potentially resulting in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26382|2024-08-03T20:26:24.544Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: An attacker with root account privileges can load any legitimately signed firmware image into the Audio Co-Processor (ACP,) irrespective of the respective signing key being declared as usable for authenticating an ACP firmware image, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26372|2024-08-03T20:26:25.279Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bound checks related to PCIE in the System Management Unit (SMU) may result in access to an invalid address space that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26362|2024-08-03T20:26:24.904Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL may be used by an attacker to issue a malformed system call which results in mapping sensitive System Management Network (SMN) registers leading to a loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2021-26400|2024-08-03T20:26:25.516Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: AMD processors may speculatively re-order load instructions which can result in stale data being observed when multiple processors are operating on shared memory, resulting in potential data leakage.

item.title: CVE-2021-26408|2024-08-03T20:26:25.323Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient validation of elliptic curve points in SEV-legacy firmware may compromise SEV-legacy guest migration potentially resulting in loss of guest's integrity or confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2021-26366|2024-08-03T20:26:25.139Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: An attacker, who gained elevated privileges via some other vulnerability, may be able to read data from Boot ROM resulting in a loss of system integrity.

item.title: CVE-2022-27677|2024-08-03T05:32:59.928Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20master
item.description: Failure to validate privileges during installation of AMD Ryzen™ Master may allow an attacker with low privileges to modify files potentially leading to privilege escalation and code execution by the lower privileged user.

item.title: CVE-2021-26342|2024-08-03T20:26:24.602Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: In SEV guest VMs, the CPU may fail to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) following a particular sequence of operations that includes creation of a new virtual machine control block (VMCB). The failure to flush the TLB may cause the microcode to use stale TLB translations which may allow for disclosure of SEV guest memory contents. Users of SEV-ES/SEV-SNP guest VMs are not impacted by this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2021-26339|2024-08-03T20:26:23.938Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: A bug in AMD CPU’s core logic may allow for an attacker, using specific code from an unprivileged VM, to trigger a CPU core hang resulting in a potential denial of service. AMD believes the specific code includes a specific x86 instruction sequence that would not be generated by compilers.

item.title: CVE-2021-26341|2024-08-03T20:26:24.678Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Some AMD CPUs may transiently execute beyond unconditional direct branches, which may potentially result in data leakage.

item.title: CVE-2022-23820|2024-08-03T03:51:46.067Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%22
item.description: Failure to validate the AMD SMM communication buffer may allow an attacker to corrupt the SMRAM potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26351|2024-08-03T20:26:24.483Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient DRAM address validation in System Management Unit (SMU) may result in a DMA (Direct Memory Access) read/write from/to invalid DRAM address that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26402|2024-08-03T20:26:25.169Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in ASP (AMD Secure Processor) firmware while handling BIOS mailbox commands, may allow an attacker to write partially-controlled data out-of-bounds to SMM or SEV-ES regions which may lead to a potential loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2022-27672|2024-08-03T05:32:59.968Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: When SMT is enabled, certain AMD processors may speculatively execute instructions using a target from the sibling thread after an SMT mode switch potentially resulting in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26346|2024-08-03T20:26:24.647Z -- amd -- ryzen%205000%20series
item.description: Failure to validate the integer operand in ASP (AMD Secure Processor) bootloader may allow an attacker to introduce an integer overflow in the L2 directory table in SPI flash resulting in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26384|2024-08-03T20:26:25.316Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malformed SMI (System Management Interface) command may allow an attacker to establish a corrupted SMI Trigger Info data structure, potentially leading to out-of-bounds memory reads and writes when triggering an SMI resulting in a potential loss of resources.

item.title: CVE-2021-26324|2024-08-03T20:19:20.327Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: A bug with the SEV-ES TMR may lead to a potential loss of memory integrity for SNP-active VMs.

item.title: CVE-2021-26313|2024-08-03T20:19:20.403Z -- amd -- all%20supported%20processors
item.description: Potential speculative code store bypass in all supported CPU products, in conjunction with software vulnerabilities relating to speculative execution of overwritten instructions, may cause an incorrect speculation and could result in data leakage.

item.title: CVE-2022-23821|2024-08-03T03:51:46.017Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%E2%80%9D
item.description: Improper access control in System Management Mode (SMM) may allow an attacker to write to SPI ROM potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26348|2024-08-03T20:26:24.674Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) of the I/O memory management unit (IOMMU) may lead an IO device to write to memory it should not be able to access, resulting in a potential loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26332|2024-08-03T20:26:23.907Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Failure to verify SEV-ES TMR is not in MMIO space, SEV-ES FW could result in a potential loss of integrity or availability.

item.title: CVE-2021-26375|2024-08-03T20:26:25.284Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient General Purpose IO (GPIO) bounds check in System Management Unit (SMU) may result in access/updates from/to invalid address space that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26314|2024-08-03T20:19:20.454Z -- amd -- all%20supported%20processors
item.description: Potential floating point value injection in all supported CPU products, in conjunction with software vulnerabilities relating to speculative execution with incorrect floating point results, may cause the use of incorrect data from FPVI and may result in data leakage.

item.title: CVE-2021-26403|2024-08-03T20:26:25.454Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient checks in SEV may lead to a malicious hypervisor disclosing the launch secret potentially resulting in compromise of VM confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2022-23831|2024-08-03T03:51:46.287Z -- amd -- amd%20%CE%BCprof
item.description: Insufficient validation of the IOCTL input buffer in AMD μProf may allow an attacker to send an arbitrary buffer leading to a potential Windows kernel crash resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2022-23818|2024-08-03T03:51:46.083Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation on the model specific register: VM_HSAVE_PA may potentially lead to loss of SEV-SNP guest memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26320|2024-08-03T20:19:20.338Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient validation of the AMD SEV Signing Key (ASK) in the SEND_START command in the SEV Firmware may allow a local authenticated attacker to perform a denial of service of the PSP

item.title: CVE-2021-26388|2024-08-03T20:26:25.337Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper validation of the BIOS directory may allow for searches to read beyond the directory table copy in RAM, exposing out of bounds memory contents, resulting in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26370|2024-08-03T20:26:24.820Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Improper validation of destination address in SVC_LOAD_FW_IMAGE_BY_INSTANCE and SVC_LOAD_BINARY_BY_ATTRIB in a malicious UApp or ABL may allow an attacker to overwrite arbitrary bootloader memory with SPI ROM contents resulting in a loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2022-23825|2024-08-03T03:51:46.140Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Aliases in the branch predictor may cause some AMD processors to predict the wrong branch type potentially leading to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26391|2024-08-03T20:26:25.325Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%205000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w5000%20series
item.description: Insufficient verification of multiple header signatures while loading a Trusted Application (TA) may allow an attacker with privileges to gain code execution in that TA or the OS/kernel.

item.title: CVE-2021-26311|2024-08-03T20:19:20.364Z -- amd -- sev%2Fsev-es
item.description: In the AMD SEV/SEV-ES feature, memory can be rearranged in the guest address space that is not detected by the attestation mechanism which could be used by a malicious hypervisor to potentially lead to arbitrary code execution within the guest VM if a malicious administrator has access to compromise the server hypervisor.

item.title: CVE-2021-26316|2024-08-03T20:19:20.402Z -- amd -- ryzen%205000%20series
item.description: Failure to validate the communication buffer and communication service in the BIOS may allow an attacker to tamper with the buffer resulting in potential SMM (System Management Mode) arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26343|2024-08-03T20:26:24.896Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient validation in ASP BIOS and DRTM commands may allow malicious supervisor x86 software to disclose the contents of sensitive memory which may result in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26350|2024-08-03T20:26:24.493Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: A TOCTOU race condition in SMU may allow for the caller to obtain and manipulate the address of a message port register which may result in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26376|2024-08-03T20:26:25.469Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient checks in System Management Unit (SMU) FeatureConfig may result in reenabling features potentially resulting in denial of resources and/or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26361|2024-08-03T20:26:24.531Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised User Application (UApp) or AGESA Boot Loader (ABL) could be used by an attacker to exfiltrate arbitrary memory from the ASP stage 2 bootloader potentially leading to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26392|2024-08-03T20:26:25.366Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%205000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w5000%20series
item.description: Insufficient verification of missing size check in 'LoadModule' may lead to an out-of-bounds write potentially allowing an attacker with privileges to gain code execution of the OS/kernel by loading a malicious TA.

item.title: CVE-2021-26404|2024-08-03T20:26:25.180Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Improper input validation and bounds checking in SEV firmware may leak scratch buffer bytes leading to potential information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26397|2024-08-03T20:26:25.294Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient address validation, may allow an attacker with a compromised ABL and UApp to corrupt sensitive memory locations potentially resulting in a loss of integrity or availability.

item.title: CVE-2021-26312|2024-08-03T20:19:20.142Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) of the I/O memory management unit (IOMMU) may lead an IO device to write to memory it should not be able to access, resulting in a potential loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26335|2024-08-03T20:26:23.907Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Improper input and range checking in the AMD Secure Processor (ASP) boot loader image header may allow an attacker to use attacker-controlled values prior to signature validation potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26386|2024-08-03T20:26:25.370Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL may be used by an attacker to issue a malformed system call to the Stage 2 Bootloader potentially leading to corrupt memory and code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-23830|2024-08-03T03:51:45.987Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: SMM configuration may not be immutable, as intended, when SNP is enabled resulting in a potential limited loss of guest memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26390|2024-08-03T20:26:25.332Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL may coerce the bootloader into corrupting arbitrary memory potentially leading to loss of integrity of data.

item.title: CVE-2021-26330|2024-08-03T20:26:23.947Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: AMD System Management Unit (SMU) may experience a heap-based overflow which may result in a loss of resources.

item.title: CVE-2022-27674|2024-08-03T05:32:59.949Z -- amd -- amd%20%CE%BCprof
item.description: Insufficient validation in the IOCTL input/output buffer in AMD μProf may allow an attacker to bypass bounds checks potentially leading to a Windows kernel crash resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26347|2024-08-03T20:26:25.052Z -- amd -- ryzen%205000%20series
item.description: Failure to validate the integer operand in ASP (AMD Secure Processor) bootloader may allow an attacker to introduce an integer overflow in the L2 directory table in SPI flash resulting in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26321|2024-08-03T20:19:20.280Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient ID command validation in the SEV Firmware may allow a local authenticated attacker to perform a denial of service of the PSP.

item.title: CVE-2021-26322|2024-08-03T20:19:20.397Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Persistent platform private key may not be protected with a random IV leading to a potential “two time pad attack”.

item.title: CVE-2021-26401|2024-08-03T20:26:25.203Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: LFENCE/JMP (mitigation V2-2) may not sufficiently mitigate CVE-2017-5715 on some AMD CPUs.

item.title: CVE-2022-23813|2024-08-03T03:51:45.988Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: The software interfaces to ASP and SMU may not enforce the SNP memory security policy resulting in a potential loss of integrity of guest memory in a confidential compute environment.

item.title: CVE-2021-26334|2024-08-03T20:26:23.943Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof%20tool
item.description: The AMDPowerProfiler.sys driver of AMD μProf tool may allow lower privileged users to access MSRs in kernel which may lead to privilege escalation and ring-0 code execution by the lower privileged user.

item.title: CVE-2021-26368|2024-08-03T20:26:25.027Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient check of the process type in Trusted OS (TOS) may allow an attacker with privileges to enable a lesser privileged process to unmap memory owned by a higher privileged process resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26317|2024-08-03T20:19:20.472Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Failure to verify the protocol in SMM may allow an attacker to control the protocol and modify SPI flash resulting in a potential arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-26326|2024-08-03T20:19:20.339Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Failure to validate VM_HSAVE_PA during SNP_INIT may result in a loss of memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26349|2024-08-03T20:26:25.008Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to assign a new report ID to an imported guest may potentially result in an SEV-SNP guest VM being tricked into trusting a dishonest Migration Agent (MA).

item.title: CVE-2021-26393|2024-08-03T20:26:25.406Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%205000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w5000%20series
item.description: Insufficient memory cleanup in the AMD Secure Processor (ASP) Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) may allow an authenticated attacker with privileges to generate a valid signed TA and potentially poison the contents of the process memory with attacker controlled data resulting in a loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2021-26345|2024-08-03T20:26:24.909Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to validate the value in APCB may allow a privileged attacker to tamper with the APCB token to force an out-of-bounds memory read potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26318|2024-08-03T20:19:20.137Z -- amd -- all%20supported%20processors
item.description: A timing and power-based side channel attack leveraging the x86 PREFETCH instructions on some AMD CPUs could potentially result in leaked kernel address space information.

item.title: CVE-2021-26352|2024-08-03T20:26:24.497Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in System Management Unit (SMU) PCIe Hot Plug table may result in access/updates from/to invalid address space that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26396|2024-08-03T20:26:25.145Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient validation of address mapping to IO in ASP (AMD Secure Processor) may result in a loss of memory integrity in the SNP guest.

item.title: CVE-2021-26406|2024-08-03T20:26:25.475Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient validation in parsing Owner's Certificate Authority (OCA) certificates in SEV (AMD Secure Encrypted Virtualization) and SEV-ES user application can lead to a host crash potentially resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26329|2024-08-03T20:19:20.294Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: AMD System Management Unit (SMU) may experience an integer overflow when an invalid length is provided which may result in a potential loss of resources.

item.title: CVE-2021-26378|2024-08-03T20:26:24.909Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in the System Management Unit (SMU) may result in access to an invalid address space that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26340|2024-08-03T20:26:23.922Z -- amd -- amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: A malicious hypervisor in conjunction with an unprivileged attacker process inside an SEV/SEV-ES guest VM may fail to flush the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) resulting in unexpected behavior inside the virtual machine (VM).

item.title: CVE-2021-26371|2024-08-03T20:26:25.196Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: A compromised or malicious ABL or UApp could send a SHA256 system call to the bootloader, which may result in exposure of ASP memory to userspace, potentially leading to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26369|2024-08-03T20:26:24.431Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL may be used by an attacker to send a malformed system call to the bootloader, resulting in out-of-bounds memory accesses.

item.title: CVE-2021-26336|2024-08-03T20:26:23.912Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in System Management Unit (SMU) may cause invalid memory accesses/updates that could result in SMU hang and subsequent failure to service any further requests from other components.

item.title: CVE-2022-23824|2024-08-03T03:51:46.071Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: IBPB may not prevent return branch predictions from being specified by pre-IBPB branch targets leading to a potential information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26337|2024-08-03T20:26:23.926Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient DRAM address validation in System Management Unit (SMU) may result in a DMA read from invalid DRAM address to SRAM resulting in SMU not servicing further requests.

item.title: CVE-2022-23814|2024-08-03T03:51:46.049Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Failure to validate addresses provided by software to BIOS commands may result in a potential loss of integrity of guest memory in a confidential compute environment.

item.title: CVE-2021-26333|2024-08-03T20:26:23.933Z -- amd -- psp%20driver
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in AMD Platform Security Processor (PSP) chipset driver. The discretionary access control list (DACL) may allow low privileged users to open a handle and send requests to the driver resulting in a potential data leak from uninitialized physical pages.

item.title: CVE-2021-26315|2024-08-03T20:19:20.391Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: When the AMD Platform Security Processor (PSP) boot rom loads, authenticates, and subsequently decrypts an encrypted FW, due to insufficient verification of the integrity of decrypted image, arbitrary code may be executed in the PSP when encrypted firmware images are used.

item.title: CVE-2022-23823|2024-08-03T03:51:46.073Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: A potential vulnerability in some AMD processors using frequency scaling may allow an authenticated attacker to execute a timing attack to potentially enable information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-27673|2024-08-03T05:33:00.325Z -- amd -- amd%20link%20android
item.description: Insufficient access controls in the AMD Link Android app may potentially result in information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-26325|2024-08-03T20:19:20.230Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SNP_GUEST_REQUEST command may lead to a potential data abort error and a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26328|2024-08-03T20:19:20.263Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Failure to verify the mode of CPU execution at the time of SNP_INIT may lead to a potential loss of memory integrity for SNP guests.

item.title: CVE-2022-23829|2024-08-03T03:51:46.075Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%20processors%205900%20wx-series
item.description: A potential weakness in AMD SPI protection features may allow a malicious attacker with Ring0 (kernel mode) access to bypass the native System Management Mode (SMM) ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2023-20570|2024-08-02T09:05:36.265Z -- amd -- alveo%E2%84%A2%20card%20%28ultrascale%E2%84%A2and%20ultrascale%2B%E2%84%A2%20based%29
item.description: Insufficient verification of data authenticity in the configuration state machine may allow a local attacker to potentially load arbitrary bitstreams.

item.title: CVE-2023-20579|2024-08-02T09:05:36.910Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: Improper Access Control in the AMD SPI protection feature may allow a user with Ring0 (kernel mode) privileged access to bypass protections potentially resulting in loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20587|2024-08-02T09:05:36.265Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper Access Control in System Management Mode (SMM) may allow an attacker access to the SPI flash potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-2193|2024-08-01T19:03:39.165Z -- amd -- cpu
item.description: A Speculative Race Condition (SRC) vulnerability that impacts modern CPU architectures supporting speculative execution (related to Spectre V1) has been disclosed. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary data from the CPU using race conditions to access the speculative executable code paths.

item.title: CVE-2024-2193|2024-07-18T15:31:14.331Z -- amd -- cpu
item.description: A Speculative Race Condition (SRC) vulnerability that impacts modern CPU architectures supporting speculative execution (related to Spectre V1) has been disclosed. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary data from the CPU using race conditions to access the speculative executable code paths.

item.title: CVE-2023-20570|2024-06-04T17:20:10.498Z -- amd -- alveo%E2%84%A2%20card%20%28ultrascale%E2%84%A2and%20ultrascale%2B%E2%84%A2%20based%29
item.description: Insufficient verification of data authenticity in the configuration state machine may allow a local attacker to potentially load arbitrary bitstreams.

item.title: CVE-2023-20587|2024-02-13T19:32:33.392Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper Access Control in System Management Mode (SMM) may allow an attacker access to the SPI flash potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20579|2024-06-04T17:20:09.206Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: Improper Access Control in the AMD SPI protection feature may allow a user with Ring0 (kernel mode) privileged access to bypass protections potentially resulting in loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-31347|2024-02-13T19:18:51.045Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Due to a code bug in Secure_TSC, SEV firmware may allow an attacker with high privileges to cause a guest to observe an incorrect TSC when Secure TSC is enabled potentially resulting in a loss of guest integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31346|2024-06-04T17:19:15.832Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to initialize memory in SEV Firmware may allow a privileged attacker to access stale data from other guests.

item.title: CVE-2024-21979|2024-06-04T17:37:40.519Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-04-23T16:36:03.933Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-2193|2024-03-15T21:25:07.075Z -- amd -- cpu
item.description: A Speculative Race Condition (SRC) vulnerability that impacts modern CPU architectures supporting speculative execution (related to Spectre V1) has been disclosed. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary data from the CPU using race conditions to access the speculative executable code paths.

item.title: CVE-2022-23829|2024-06-18T19:01:57.007Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%20processors%205900%20wx-series
item.description: A potential weakness in AMD SPI protection features may allow a malicious attacker with Ring0 (kernel mode) access to bypass the native System Management Mode (SMM) ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2021-46757|2024-06-18T18:46:02.340Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20embedded%205000
item.description: Insufficient checking of memory buffer in ASP Secure OS may allow an attacker with a malicious TA to read/write to the ASP Secure OS kernel virtual address space potentially leading to privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-07-24T18:06:16.832Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.description: Due to a code bug in Secure_TSC, SEV firmware may allow an attacker with high privileges to cause a guest to observe an incorrect TSC when Secure TSC is enabled potentially resulting in a loss of guest integrity.
